result.execSummary:
The defendant Leonard M Pilcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 8:48 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Defendant Leonard M Pilcher in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ confirms victim rights compliance. Court so finds

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
DA Happ submits victim impact statement

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions as set forth on the criminal case settlement form, which include:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--Maintain absolute sobriety; no presence in bars or taverns
--Fine and/or costs
--Other costs/fees

Court additionally orders:
--For the Defendant to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff Dept. following today's hearing to provide a DNA Sample
--Pay DNA Surcharge as part of probation
--To pay the domestic abuse surcharge as part of probation
--To pay $33 subpoena fees as part of probation
APPLY CASH BOND

Days credit for time already served: 4 days
Recess: 9:18 am
Status conference on June 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Leonard M Pilcher
Current: 200 Truman Ave., Room 109, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 04-18-2016)
Prior: 1660 South Church St., Watertown, WI 53094 United States

Case called at 1:26 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Leonard M Pilcher in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa on behalf. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that Mr. Pilcher remains eligible for SPD representation
Bond arguments by Counsel

The Court requires $250 CASH Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with victim Bailey Pilcher
--no presence at 1153 Boughton Street, #15G in Watertown
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses
--upon his release, from the very first night of release, Mr. Pilcher is to stay at the Hilltop Hotel in Jefferson; eviction from the Hilltop Hotel will be considered as a violation of this Bond
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS (the Court is not allowing for the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative in this case). The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to have SCRAM installation before release from custody. 
Court informs parties that they can schedule a bond modification hearing with Judge Wambach's judicial assistant
Recess: 1:31 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 6/21/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD
Duplicate Original Warrant returned from JCSD
Based upon failure to appear on 8/17/15 Bond Modification Hearing and 8/24/15 FSSC.
Per 8/24/15 minutes so that new warrant document can be prepared.

Case called at 2:37pm [mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC and Motion Hearing]
Defendant Leonard M Pilcher does not appear  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney John Smerlinski appears via telephone 
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek does NOT appear

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

The Court reviews the Court Record

On Smerlinski's Motion to Withdraw:
--no objection from ADA Hall
--the Court authorizes Attorney Smerlinski to be removed from this case and should no longer be included in the Court's distribution

Attorney Smerlinski end telephone appearance at 2:39pm

The Court continues bench warrant
The Court notifies the State that it may release any of its witnesses at this time

The Court further reviews the Court Record, including letter from Def. re: bond modification
The Court orders that the Trial on the Court's calendar be removed.
The Court directs the Clerk to prepare a new warrant for failure to appear at todays FSSC and 8/17/15 Bond Modification Hearing. The Warrant should be a bench warrant, body only
ADA Hall orally motions for bond forfeiture. The Court finds bond to be in default and bond to be forfeited. 
recess: 2:46pm
NOH for Def. for 8/17/15 Motion Hrg.//sent to LKA
Court orders a hearing be set. Attorney Smerlinski may appear by phone. Mr. Pilcher is to appear personally. cc: all
States request to extend deadline is granted
from the State regarding witness availibility
Motion to withdraw submitted by Attorney Smerlinski

Case called at 11:33am [mo]
[Scheduled for Motion Hearing]
Defendant Leonard M Pilcher not in court.   Atty. John Smerlinski does not appear in court. ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek is present in the courtroom gallery

ADA Hall summarizes court record.
The Court continues the bench warrant previously issued
The Court finds bond in default and orders it forfeit.

The Court notes that Atty. Smerlinski has filed an Authorization, does not take any action at this time
The Court does not remove Atty. Svehlek from the case at this time
Upon inquiry of Atty. Svehlek, the Court does not remove the FSSC and Jury Trial from the calendar at this time. Further, the Court notes that the Public Defender office does NOT need to be prepared for the Jury Trial, it will expect the State and Atty. Smerlinski to be prepared. The Court will address counsel at FSSC. 
recess:11:38am
Letter from the State requesting an extension ref Court's Scheduling Order
Court's response to defendant's letter: Set for expedited bond modification hearing/right to counsel- 8:10 am if necessary cc: state & defendant
For alleged SCRAM violation - See attached. Defendant to be brought before Branch 3 upon arrest not intake Court.

made by the Defense on this date

[MK case called at 1:39pm. 
Defendant Leonard M Pilcher appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Complaint is correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial demanded by the Defense.

The Court requires a $2,500 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no contact with victim Bailey Pilcher
--no presence at 1153 Boughton Street, #15G in Watertown
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, package houses
--upon his release, from the very first night of release, Mr. Pilcher is to stay at the Hilltop Hotel in Jefferson; eviction from the Hilltop Hotel will be considered as a violation of this Bond
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession of drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription
--the Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS (the Court is not allowing for the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative in this case). The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to have SCRAM installation before release from custody. 
recess 1:48pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 8/12/15 at 8:40am  (2) FSSC on 8/24/15 at 3:00pm (3) Jury Trial on 8/27 and/or 8/28/15 at 8:30am (JA- please note in comments that speedy trial time limits pend)
